title:
Nonparametric estimation of linear multiplier for stochastic
  differential equations driven by multiplicative stochastic volatility
abstract:
We study the problem of nonparametric estimation of the linear multiplier
function $\theta(t)$ for processes satisfying stochastic differential equations
of the type $$dX_t= \theta(t)X_t dt+ \epsilon\;
\sigma_1(t,X_t)\sigma_2(t,Y_t)dW_t, X_0=x_0, 0 \leq t \leq T$$ where $\{W_t,
t\geq 0\}$ is a standard Brownian motion, $\{Y_t, t\geq 0\}$ is a process
adapted to the filtration generated by the Brownian motion. We study the
problem of estimation of the unknown function $\theta(.)$ as $\epsilon
\rightarrow 0$ based on the observation of the process $\{X_t,0\leq t \leq
T\}.$
